metadata.title: CVE-2021-30002 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.11.3 when a webcamdevice exists. video_usercopy in drivers/media/v4l2-core/v4l2-ioctl.c has amemory leak for large arguments, aka CID-fb18802a338b.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30002` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1126.140
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1102.109~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1099.112~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1071.79~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
